lead_paragraph: A Washington dispatch described the "bits and pieces" system by which Axis agents sometimes get news that is helpful to them. The source is gossip that seems harmless: A factory worker telling of orders for assault boats; a produce merchant telling of a Navy order for vegetables; a girl telling another girl that her boy friend, a parachute trooper, is "going across Tuesday."
abstract: Ed on dangerous gossip and rumor-mongering
